pages.title: Intro to Beams
pages.text: Wait! This is a mid-game feature. By this point, you should have <em>at least/$ $(l:rotary/millstone)ore doubling/$ (if not $(l:rotary/stamp)tripling/$), $(l:fluid/centrifuge)automated salt production/$, and probably a $(l:fluid/fat_collector)stable food source/$. If you don't, <thing>beams/$ are going to be too expensive to run.$(br2)<thing>Beams/$ are a powerful way of creating various

effects in the world. They can do things like summoning lightning, producing redstone, placing blocks, and more. They look like giant colorful laser beams.$(br2)Every <thing>beam/$ has two traits: <thing>power/$ and <thing>alignment/$. The <thing>power/$ controls the intensity of effects (capped at <thing>power/$=64), while the <thing>alignment/$ controls what the effect is. Effects are applied every 5 ticks for a continuous beam.

Each beam is composed of four resources, each of which is a certain color: <thing>Energy/$- red, <thing>Potential/$- green, <thing>Stability/$- blue, and <thing>$(l:beam/void)Void/$- black. <thing>Void/$ is later game, and won't be used early on.$(br2)The <thing>power/$ of the beam is the total quantity of the four resources (<thing>energy/$ + <thing>potential/$ + <thing>stability/$ + <thing>void/$).$(br2)The <thing>alignment/$ is based on the color of the overall beam- the four (early game

just three) resources in the beam combine their colors like on a color wheel. Certain <thing>alignments/$ require more specific colors than others- making them harder to make. The <item>$(l:beam/chart)color chart/$ will help you discover <thing>alignments/$ you're missing.$(br2)You also need to discover <thing>alignments/$- once you discover one, an entry will appear in this book. You can use an <item>$(l:intro/omnimeter)omnimeter/$ to measure <thing>beams/$, and discover the <thing>alignment/$ if you haven't discovered

Many <thing>beam alignments/$ will transmute blocks they hit in the world if they are high enough power.$(br2)<thing>Beams/$ are usually moved around with <item>$(l:beam/reflector)beam reflectors/$, and created with a <item>$(l:beam/extractor)Resonance Extractor/$. Every machine or block a <thing>beam/$ travels through adds a 5 tick (quarter second) delay, and beams have a 16 block range between machines for transmission.
